column4: Hi everyone!!! Somebody know how to use 4GB on ram on Ubuntu hardy 32 bits? is it there an instruction for the kernel?
i got a problem with some ram ( 4gb) on Ubuntu 32 bits
My SO con use all the ram only 3.1 gb
and i do not want to use a 64 bit ubuntu
is there any instruction for the kernel?=
YEAP cuz PAE is it for old processors?
You have to compile the kernel with the options set. I think its called CONFIG_HIGHMEM in your .config, dunno what the options called in a menu.
or isntall 64 bit ubuntu, which can do much more ram.
model name : Intel(R) Core(TM)2 Duo CPU     T7100  @ 1.80GHz
ok... the 2 options are good in fact i tried to use a 64 bits SO, but some app didnt work
﻿strocknar: and other things using the same gateway can get out?
you can try the config option, #kernel on freenode should help out there.
